refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: AQL% SELECT aggregate(attribute) [,aggregate(attribute)] ... INTO dst-array FROM src-array | array-expression WHERE where-expression REGRID AS ( PARTITION BY dimension1 dimension1-size [, dimension2 dimension2-size]... ) ;

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The regrid operator partitions the cells in the input array into blocks, and for each block, apply a specific aggregate operation over the value(s) of some attribute in each block.
regrid does not allow grids to span array chunks and requires the chunk size to be a multiple of the grid size in each dimension.

informalexample.para: This example divides a 4Ã—4 array into 4 equal partitions and calculates the average of each one. This process is known as spatial averaging.

step.para: Create an array m4x4:CREATE ARRAY m4x4 <val:double> [i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0];
Regrid m4x4 into four partitions and find the average of each partition.regrid(m4x4, 2,2, sum(val));This query outputs:[[(2.5),(4.5)],[(10.5),(12.5)]]
